creator: asqiir

title: mailboxen van 3 jaar oud plotseling weer terug; huidige gegevens verdwenen
content:
Ongeveer drie jaar geleden was plotseling mijn hele mailbox verdwenen. Ik heb toen met hulp van dit forum van alles geprobeerd om hem terug te krijgen, maar tevergeefs. Toen ben ik maar helemaal opnieuw begonnen. Erg vervelend, want ik was dus ook mijn adressenboek kwijt, en er waren allerlei mails waarop ik nog moest reageren en dat kon ik dus niet meer. Enfin, uiteindelijk draait alles weer.

Gisterochtend zette ik mijn computer aan, en tot mijn verbazing werd gevraagd om mijn wachtwoord te geven. Dat heb ik gedaan, en daarop kwamen de nieuwe mails binnen. Maar tot mijn grote verbazing bleek dat mijn hele inbox was vervangen door die zoekgeraakte inbox van drie jaar geleden! Ook mijn adressenboek was vervangen door het oude zoekgeraakte exemplaar, waarin dus alle nieuwe contacten ontbreken, en waarin ik allerlei inmiddels overleden contactpersonen terugvind, alsmede mailadressen die inmiddels niet meer werken.

Ik moet natuurlijk mijn mailbestanden van eergisteren weer terug hebben. Ik heb nu geen idee hoe ik dat moet proberen te doen. Ik weet dat die zouden moeten staan in de map met 8 willekeurige tekens en dan .default, en die map is van vandaag. Er is ook nog een vergelijkbaar mapje van 1 september vorig jaar. Er is ook een map 'Crash Reports', met als meest recente bestand 'InstallTime20250404084548'.

Wie helpt me uit de misère? Alvast hartelijk bedankt, Erik.
creator: erik103

title: All emails vanished
content:
Hey kind people,

I was shocked to discover that all of my unarchived emails have suddenly disappeared. The trash folders are empty. No filters are active. Only the archived and junk mail survived ... yippieh ...

I just opened Thunderbird on my PC when I noticed that all emails from my Hotmail, iCloud, and Gmail accounts were gone. A fourth work account is not affected. On my laptop, I briefly saw the emails still there, but then everything updated and they were gone as well.

So I’m still not sure what exactly happened, whether it’s Thunderbird causing this or if something else went wrong.

Is there any reliable way to recover the emails?

Best regards Chris

title: I changed Gmail passwords; Thunderbird Enter Credentials page is blank. Gmail account says TB has access.
content:
I updated my passwords to be more secure, now I can't get Thunderbird to login.

The page TB throws up to enter my new credentials is blank (all black). Changing colours in TB did not fix this.

I copied the URL from the TB blank credentials screen to another browser and was able to give TB access again. But since the response from Google is to 127.0.0.1, and the TB page URL is non-editable, I don't think TB gets the message. I have 2FA turned off on these accounts. These accounts show TB has access.

But, TB just throws up endless blank screens for me. And won't check the mail on those accounts.

An Outlook user had the same problem, but their fix (never allowing page colour changes) didn't work for me.
creator: justthisguyyouknow

title: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com failed"
content:
For a week, I have not been able to send any emails through Thunderbird.

This is the only day that I have been able to delve further into the problem.

If I send an email, this is the response that I get after sending. Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

I have contacted my main provider and they have been useless. I contacted my secondary provider and they sent me what the settings should be. I checked their info against mine and everything is correct.

I prefer Mozilla products over all others and I wish to get this corrected sooner later, I have two assignments to send over the weekend.

I would rather being doing something else that trying to figure out this problem.

I should be celebrating or mourning the passing of my wife 3 years ago, than trying to figure out what is wrong.

One thing I did do was to go to the Mozilla website and download Thunderbird again in case there was a conflict somewhere in the system.

Thanking you in advance. K
creator: kerryjnewstead

Refunds and Compensation If you’re entitled to a refund or compensation, contacting a live person ((+1→8.8.8→[349]→[6080])) OTA ensures that your case is handled properly. This can include flight refunds, hotel refunds, or compensation for disruptions.
